item.title: Claude 3.7 Now Available in GitHub Copilot for Visual Studio
item.description: The world of AI is evolving at a breathtaking pace, and today brings an exciting milestone for developers and tech enthusiasts alike. Anthropicâ€™s newest release, Claude 3.7, is now available directly within GitHub Copilot for Visual Studio 2022 17.13, heralding a new era of seamlessly integrated, advanced AI coding assistance. This new Sonnet model supports [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/claude-3-7-now-available-in-github-copilot-for-visual-studio

item.title: Compatibility of PostgreSQL Connector with AWS and GCP
item.description: As AI-driven applications continue to evolve, the need for efficient vector-based search capabilities is greater than ever. Microsoft Semantic Kernel makes it easy to integrate these capabilities with PostgreSQL databases using the Postgres connector. Whether youâ€™re leveraging cloud-hosted PostgreSQL instances on Amazon Web Services or Google Cloud, this connector enables seamless interaction, allowing you to [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/semantic-kernel/compatibility-of-postgresql-connector-with-aws-and-gcp

item.title: Leverage vision in Copilot Chat

Or perhaps youâ€™re debugging an issue and need to share a [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/attach-images-in-github-copilot-chat

item.title: std::generator: Standard Library Coroutine Support
item.description: std::generator is a C++23 feature that enables you to write concise, straightforward functions that generate sequences of values on-demand without manually managing state. It builds upon C++20â€™s coroutines, providing some standard library support for this powerful, but complex, language feature. As of Visual Studio 2022 version 17.13, we ship an implementation of std::generator in our [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cppblog/std-generator-standard-library-coroutine-support

item.title: Hybrid Model Orchestration
item.description: Hybrid model orchestration is a powerful technique that AI applications can use to intelligently select and switch between multiple models based on various criteria, all while being transparent to the calling code. This technique not only allows for model selection based on factors such as the promptâ€™s input token size and each modelâ€™s min/max token [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/semantic-kernel/hybrid-model-orchestration

item.title: MSVC Address Sanitizer updates in Visual Studio 2022 version 17.13
item.description: We have been investing in the quality of MSVC Address Sanitizer (ASan) in several key areas over the past year, including working with LLVM upstream to stay coordinated with their changes, adding coverage for internal tools and libraries, and hardening APIs and runtime modes.Â Upstreaming to LLVMÂ MSVC ASan is derived from a fork of [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cppblog/msvc-address-sanitizer-updates-in-visual-studio-2022-version-17-13

item.title: Successfully leveraging stakeholder feedback with Comment Analytics
item.description: Â Agencies in the U.S. federal government publish an average of 3,700 proposed rules yearly, according to the U.S. Government Accountability Office.Â With each proposed rule, agencies generally provide an opportunity for stakeholders and members of the public to submit comments before the rules are finalized.Â In some instances, thousands of comments are submitted, with [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azuregov/successfully-leveraging-stakeholder-feedback-with-comment-analytics

item.description: Deployment: Letâ€™s do it! All operations are performed in the VM Prerequisites everything is on-premises and free (except VM) The only thing you need is: a VM Memory: 16G is recommended Operating system: Ubuntu 22.04 (recommended, other operating systems have no difference except Docker installation) Port:Â 3000Â port needs to be released for Grafana to use, andÂ 22Â port [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/all-things-azure/visualize-roi-of-your-github-copilot-usage-deploy-it

item.title: Visualize ROI of your GitHub Copilot Usage, How it works!
item.description: Architecture: How it works! The Copilot Usage Advanced Dashboard offers a comprehensive suite of features designed to revolutionize how organizations track and analyze their Copilot usage. At its core, the solution leverages Elasticsearch for persistent data storage, breaking free from the traditional 28-day limitation and enabling analysis across extended time periods, from months to years. [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/all-things-azure/visualize-roi-of-your-github-copilot-usage-how-it-works

item.title: Automating Developer Environments with Microsoft Dev Box and Teams Customizations Part 2
item.description: Developers today typically work on multiple projects simultaneously, with each project requiring different tools and configuration requirements. Being able to have a dedicated environment explicitly configured to that project unlocks enhanced developer productivity and reduces outside noise, allowing developers to focus just on the work they are doing. This also extends to developers who may [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/develop-from-the-cloud/automating-developer-environments-with-microsoft-dev-box-and-teams-customizations-part-2

We understand this wasnâ€™t the most [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/function-calling-is-now-enabled-in-github-copilot

item.title: Moving to TLS 1.2 for Azure Cosmos DB: Ensuring Secure Connections
item.description: Security and reliability are at the core of modern cloud applications. To strengthen data protection and align with industry best practices, we encourage all Azure Cosmos DB customers to transition to TLS 1.2. This post explains why this change is important, how to make the transition, and the benefits it brings to your applications. Why [â€¦] Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/moving-to-tls-1-2-for-azure-cosmos-db-ensuring-secure-connections
